application.name: PJSIPHangup
application.synopsis: Hangup an incoming PJSIP channel with a SIP response code

enum.name: Response code
enum.para: A numeric response code in the range 400 ->699

enum.name: Response code name
enum.para: A response code name from third-party/pjproject/source/pjsip/include/pjsip/sip_msg.h such as USE_IDENTITY_HEADER or PJSIP_SC_USE_IDENTITY_HEADER

description.para: Hangs up an incoming PJSIP channel and returns the specified SIP response code in the final response to the caller.

warning.para: This function must be called BEFORE anything that might cause any other final (non 1XX) response to be sent. For example calling Answer() or Playback without the noanswer option will cause the call to be answered and a final 200 response to be sent.

description.para: As with the Hangup application, the dialplan will terminate after calling this function.
The cause code set on the channel will be translated to a standard ISDN cause code using the table defined in ast_sip_hangup_sip2cause() in res_pjsip.c

example.title: Terminate call with 437 response code using the response code name
Terminate call with 437 response code based on condition

application.name: PJSIPNotify
application.synopsis: Send a NOTIFY to either an arbitrary URI, or inside a SIP dialog.

parameter.name: to
parameter.para: Arbitrary URI to which to send the NOTIFY. If none is specified, send inside the SIP dialog for the current channel.

parameter.name: content
parameter.para: Either an option pre-configured in pjsip_notify.conf or a list of headers and body content to send in the NOTIFY.

description.para: Sends a NOTIFY to a specified URI, or if none provided, within the current SIP dialog for the current channel. The content can either be set to either an entry configured in pjsip_notify.conf or specified as a list of key value pairs.

warning.para: To send a NOTIFY to a specified URI, a default_outbound_endpoint must be configured. This endpoint determines the message contact.

example.title: Send a NOTIFY with Event and X-Data headers in current dialog
Send a preconfigured NOTIFY force-answer defined in pjsip_notify.conf in current dialog
Send a NOTIFY to <sip:bob@127.0.0.1:5260> with Test Event and X-Data headers
Send a NOTIFY to <sip:bob@127.0.0.1:5260> with Custom Event and message body

manager.name: PJSIPHangup
manager.synopsis: Hangup an incoming PJSIP channel with a SIP response code

description.para: Hangs up an incoming PJSIP channel and returns the specified SIP response code in the final response to the caller.

warning.para: This function must be called BEFORE anything that might cause any other final (non 1XX) response to be sent. For example calling Answer() or Playback without the noanswer option will cause the call to be answered and a final 200 response to be sent.

description.para: The cause code set on the channel will be translated to a standard ISDN cause code using the table defined in ast_sip_hangup_sip2cause() in res_pjsip.c
description.example: Action: PJSIPHangup ActionID: 12345678 Channel: PJSIP/alice-00000002 Cause: 437

example.title: Terminate call with 437 response code using the response code name

description.example: Action: PJSIPHangup ActionID: 12345678 Channel: PJSIP/alice-00000002 Cause: UNSUPPORTED_CERTIFICATE

function.name: PJSIP_DIAL_CONTACTS
function.synopsis: Return a dial string for dialing all contacts on an AOR.

parameter.name: aor
parameter.para: Name of an AOR to use, if not specified the configured AORs on the endpoint are used

parameter.name: request_user
parameter.para: Optional request user to use in the request URI

description.para: Returns a properly formatted dial string for dialing all contacts on an AOR.

function.name: PJSIP_MEDIA_OFFER
function.synopsis: Media and codec offerings to be set on an outbound SIP channel prior to dialing.

description.para: When read, returns the codecs offered based upon the media choice.
When written, sets the codecs to offer when an outbound dial attempt is made, or when a session refresh is sent using PJSIP_SEND_SESSION_REFRESH.

function.name: PJSIP_DTMF_MODE
function.synopsis: Get or change the DTMF mode for a SIP call.

description.para: When read, returns the current DTMF mode
When written, sets the current DTMF mode
This function uses the same DTMF mode naming as the dtmf_mode configuration option

function.name: PJSIP_MOH_PASSTHROUGH
function.synopsis: Get or change the on-hold behavior for a SIP call.

description.para: When read, returns the current moh passthrough mode
When written, sets the current moh passthrough mode
If yes, on-hold re-INVITEs are sent. If no, music on hold is generated.
This function can be used to override the moh_passthrough configuration option

function.name: PJSIP_SEND_SESSION_REFRESH
function.synopsis: W/O: Initiate a session refresh via an UPDATE or re-INVITE on an established media session

parameter.name: update_type
parameter.para: The type of update to send. Default is invite.

enum.name: invite
enum.para: Send the session refresh as a re-INVITE.

enum.name: update
enum.para: Send the session refresh as an UPDATE.

description.para: This function will cause the PJSIP stack to immediately refresh the media session for the channel. This will be done using either a re-INVITE (default) or an UPDATE request.
This is most useful when combined with the PJSIP_MEDIA_OFFER dialplan function, as it allows the formats in use on a channel to be re-negotiated after call setup.

warning.para: The formats the endpoint supports are not checked or enforced by this function. Using this function to offer formats not supported by the endpoint may result in a loss of media.

description.example: ; Within some existing extension on an answered channel same => n,Set(PJSIP_MEDIA_OFFER(audio)=!all,g722) same => n,Set(PJSIP_SEND_SESSION_REFRESH()=invite)

function.name: PJSIP_PARSE_URI
function.synopsis: Parse a URI and return a type part of the URI.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: The type parameter specifies which URI part to read

description.para: Parse a URI and return a specified part of the URI.

function.name: PJSIP_PARSE_URI_FROM
function.synopsis: Parse the contents of a variable as a URI and return a type part of the URI.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.para: Name of a variable that contains a URI to parse

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: The type parameter specifies which URI part to read

description.para: Parse the contents of the provided variable as a URI and return a specified part of the URI.

function.name: PJSIP_TRANSFER_HANDLING
function.synopsis: Set how transfers are handled for a PJSIP channel.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.para: How transfers are handled for a PJSIP channel. Default is core.

enum.name: core
enum.para: Asterisk will handle attended and blind transfers.

enum.name: ari-only
enum.para: Asterisk will generate ARI events on incoming SIP REFER.

description.para: When written, sets the transferhandling behavior

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: When rtp is specified, the type parameter must be provided. It specifies which RTP parameter to read.

enum.name: src
enum.para: Retrieve the local address for RTP.

enum.name: dest
enum.para: Retrieve the remote address for RTP.

enum.name: direct
enum.para: If direct media is enabled, this address is the remote address used for RTP.

enum.name: secure
enum.para: Whether or not the media stream is encrypted.
The media stream is not encrypted.

enum.name: hold
enum.para: Whether or not the media stream is currently restricted due to a call hold.
The media stream is not held.

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.para: When rtp is specified, the media_type parameter may be provided. It specifies which media stream the chosen RTP parameter should be retrieved from.

enum.name: audio
enum.para: Retrieve information from the audio media stream.

note.para: If not specified, audio is used by default.

enum.name: video
enum.para: Retrieve information from the video media stream.

parameter.name: statistic
parameter.para: When rtcp is specified, the statistic parameter must be provided. It specifies which RTCP statistic parameter to read.

enum.name: all
enum.para: Retrieve a summary of all RTCP statistics.
The following data items are returned in a semi-colon delineated list:

enum.name: all_jitter
enum.para: Retrieve a summary of all RTCP Jitter statistics.
The following data items are returned in a semi-colon delineated list:

enum.name: all_loss
enum.para: Retrieve a summary of all RTCP packet loss statistics.
The following data items are returned in a semi-colon delineated list:

enum.name: all_rtt
enum.para: Retrieve a summary of all RTCP round trip time information.
The following data items are returned in a semi-colon delineated list:

enum.name: all_mes
enum.para: Retrieve a summary of all RTCP Media Experience Score information.
The following data items are returned in a semi-colon delineated list:

enum.name: minmes
enum.para: Minimum MES based on us analysing received packets.

enum.name: maxmes
enum.para: Maximum MES based on us analysing received packets.

enum.name: avgmes
enum.para: Average MES based on us analysing received packets.

enum.name: stdevmes
enum.para: Standard deviation MES based on us analysing received packets.

enum.name: reported_minmes
enum.para: Minimum MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: reported_maxmes
enum.para: Maximum MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: reported_avgmes
enum.para: Average MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: reported_stdevmes
enum.para: Standard deviation MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: txmes
enum.para: Current MES based on us analyzing rtt, jitter and loss in the actual received RTP stream received from the remote end. I.E. This is the MES for the incoming audio stream.

enum.name: rxmes
enum.para: Current MES based on rtt and the jitter and loss values in RTCP sender and receiver reports we receive from the remote end. I.E. This is the MES for the outgoing audio stream.

enum.name: remote_maxmes
enum.para: Max MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: remote_minmes
enum.para: Min MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: remote_normdevmes
enum.para: Average MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: remote_stdevmes
enum.para: Standard deviation MES based on data we get in Sender and Receiver Reports sent by the remote end

enum.name: local_maxmes
enum.para: Max MES based on us analyzing the received RTP stream

enum.name: local_minmes
enum.para: Min MES based on us analyzing the received RTP stream

enum.name: local_normdevmes
enum.para: Average MES based on us analyzing the received RTP stream

enum.name: local_stdevmes
enum.para: Standard deviation MES based on us analyzing the received RTP stream

parameter.name: media_type
parameter.para: When rtcp is specified, the media_type parameter may be provided. It specifies which media stream the chosen RTCP parameter should be retrieved from.

enum.name: audio
enum.para: Retrieve information from the audio media stream.

note.para: If not specified, audio is used by default.

enum.name: video
enum.para: Retrieve information from the video media stream.

enum.name: endpoint
enum.para: R/O The name of the endpoint associated with this channel. Use the PJSIP_ENDPOINT function to obtain further endpoint related information.

enum.name: contact
enum.para: R/O The name of the contact associated with this channel. Use the PJSIP_CONTACT function to obtain further contact related information. Note this may not be present and if so is only available on outgoing legs.

enum.name: aor
enum.para: R/O The name of the AOR associated with this channel. Use the PJSIP_AOR function to obtain further AOR related information. Note this may not be present and if so is only available on outgoing legs.

enum.name: pjsip
enum.para: R/O Obtain information about the current PJSIP channel and its session.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: When pjsip is specified, the type parameter must be provided. It specifies which signalling parameter to read.

enum.name: secure
enum.para: Whether or not the signalling uses a secure transport.
The signalling uses a non-secure transport.
The signalling uses a secure transport.

enum.name: target_uri
enum.para: The contact URI where requests are sent.

enum.name: request_uri
enum.para: The request URI of the incoming INVITE associated with the creation of this channel.

enum.name: t38state
enum.para: The current state of any T.38 fax on this channel.

enum.name: DISABLED
enum.para: T.38 faxing is disabled on this channel.

enum.name: LOCAL_REINVITE
enum.para: Asterisk has sent a re-INVITE to the remote end to initiate a T.38 fax.

enum.name: REMOTE_REINVITE
enum.para: The remote end has sent a re-INVITE to Asterisk to initiate a T.38 fax.

enum.name: ENABLED
enum.para: A T.38 fax session has been enabled.

enum.name: REJECTED
enum.para: A T.38 fax session was attempted but was rejected.

enum.name: local_addr
enum.para: On inbound calls, the full IP address and port number that the INVITE request was received on. On outbound calls, the full IP address and port number that the INVITE request was transmitted from.

enum.name: remote_addr
enum.para: On inbound calls, the full IP address and port number that the INVITE request was received from. On outbound calls, the full IP address and port number that the INVITE request was transmitted to.

info.name: CHANNEL_EXAMPLES
info.example:
; Log the current Call-ID same => n,Log(NOTICE, ${CHANNEL(pjsip,call-id)})
; Log the destination address of the audio stream same => n,Log(NOTICE, ${CHANNEL(rtp,dest)})
; Store the round-trip time associated with a ; video stream in the CDR field video-rtt same => n,Set(CDR(video-rtt)=${CHANNEL(rtcp,rtt,video)})
